law.catch_line: Use of title indicating certification -- Performance of services by person not certified.

text.section: No person shall use the title "certified interior designer," the letters CID, or any acronym, abbreviation, or title that would imply certification under this chapter unless the person at the time holds a valid certificate to use the title "certified interior designer" in the Commonwealth of Kentucky as established under KRS 323.400 to 323.416 and 323.992.

Nothing in KRS 323.400 to 323.416 or 323.992 prohibits a person who is not certified as a certified interior designer from providing interior design services or from using any title, sign, card, or device indicating that the person provides interior design services.

law.history: Amended 2008 Ky. Acts ch. 59, sec. 4, effective July 15, 2008. -- Created 2002 Ky. Acts ch. 55, sec. 2, effective July 15, 2002.
